page.title: 05 EXCAVATION 1970-82
page.content: Between 1970 and 1982 the site of the castle earthworks beside the church were excavated by the Extra-Mural studies department Oxford University. The dig produced evidence of settlement in the area.The evidence suggested the earliest settlement was late Iron Age.This was followed by Roman settlement which had been previously unsuspected. A large Anglo-Saxon settlement succeeded this and the Domesday entry suggests that Middleton Stoney was fairly important at the time. The castle has been dated about the 12'th century or early 13'th and was destroyed about the year 1216 .The dig has suggested that the village is a good example of life in the Medieval period.The evidence is stored in the library at Woodstock.
